You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SET UP AND MAINTAIN NET ZERO CLOUD
Set Up Net Zero Cloud Users

Configure user profiles, permission sets, and other security features in your Net Zero Cloud org.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions

As a system administrator, before you configure the app:

Confirm that your org has the Net Zero Cloud permission set license. If not, contact your account executive.
If your org has the Net Zero Cloud permission set license, assign yourself the Net Zero Cloud permission set license and the Net Zero Cloud Manager permission set.
Enable Net Zero Cloud
To efficiently capture and audit your carbon footprint, enable Net Zero Cloud.
Create Net Zero Cloud Profiles
A profile defines how users access objects and data and what they can do in the app. Typically Net Zero Cloud profile names reflect the role of the user. Assign users a profile based on their role. To assign permissions specific to Net Zero Cloud, clone an existing Salesforce Standard User profile and assign the corresponding permission sets to users.
Enable App Access
Enable access to the Net Zero Cloud app for your profile.
Add Net Zero Cloud Users
Add and assign profiles to Net Zero Cloud users.
Assign a Permission Set License to Users
The features that a user can access depend on the permission set license assigned to the user. If the license isn’t available, contact your account executive.
Permission Sets in Net Zero Cloud
The Salesforce platform, which underlies Net Zero Cloud, provides many base permission sets. The available permission sets depend on the product solution and add-ons that you purchase. Net Zero Cloud provides additional permission sets.
